page.title: 12INDUSTRY
page.content: {Redhill Farm Pottery:}Mr and Mrs Harris make small pottery animals and larger Old Testament figures. Because of their Christian beliefs they have chosen the 'Fish' sign to stamp their work, which is widely sold both locally and in America.{Alpine {Nursery,Broadwell:}Mr Elliott started his alpine nursery in 1946, selling slow-growing, hardy little plants normally grown in mountainous areas. They are suitable for rock gardens, troughs and pots. People come hundreds of miles to buy from the attractive farm yard where plants are grown from cuttings and seeds.{Chair-making, {Oddington:}Mr Sparling makes rush- seated chairs in ash wood using traditional styles and methods. The backs are bent in a steam box, the legs and rails turned on a lathe, the seats woven with locally grown rush.
